page.title: 11A Day out at Gillerthwaite
page.content: We woke up early and got dressed.Breakfast was at 8.0O'clock.My group had to help to prepare it and then wash up afterwards.By the time we had got our things ready and made our sandwiches it was 10.00a.a.m. We set off in a group of 12 children and 2 teachers to go up Red Pike.We set off on a path that took us up above the tree line.It was hard going after this and the path was step in parts.At last we reached the top.We had a superb view of the lakes Buttermere,Crummock and the fells beyond. After eating our lunch which we were ready for we took some photographs and then made our descent.By the timewe got back to the centre it was late afternoon.We had time to go for a swim in the River that runs past the centre.
